snippet: Anger over two fatal police shootings in Anaheim, Calif., the home of Disneyland, has led to the eruption of longstanding race and class tensions.
abstract: Police shootings have reinforced a racial and class rift in Anaheim, Calif, the home of Disneyland, and a city of nearly 350,000 made up mostly of working-class Hispanics on the west side and wealthier, white people in the more sparsely populated eastern hills.

byline.contributor: Ian Lovett contributed reporting from Los Angeles.

lead_paragraph: Anger over two fatal police shootings in Anaheim, Calif., the home of Disneyland, has led to the eruption of longstanding race and class tensions.

headline.seo: Anaheim Protests Show Deep Divides in Class and Race
headline.main: Fury Reveals Deep Rifts Near ‘Happiest Place on Earth’
headline.print_headline: Near ‘Happiest Place on Earth,’ Fury After Shootings Reveals Deep Divisions
